snippet.title: What's behind conviction of Russian opposition activist Alexei Navalny?
snippet.description:
* Kremlin critic and Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny has been convicted of misappropriating $500,000 worth of state-owned timber.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/07/20/world/europe/russia-alexei-navalny-explainer/index.html

snippet.title: Will Russians heed Navalny’s call for action?
snippet.description:
* By William Pomeranz, Special to CNN Editor’s note: William Pomeranz is the deputy director of the Kennan Institute for Advanced Russian Studies of the Woodrow Wilson Center in Washington, D.C. The views expressed are his own. Anti-corruption campaigner...
http://globalpublicsquare.blogs.cnn.com/2013/07/24/will-russians-heed-navalnys-call-for-action/

snippet.title: Terrorist trainer or opinionated cleric? Abu Hamza al-Masri's trial begins
snippet.description:
* The federal trial of Abu Hamza al-Masri, a radical Islamic cleric accused of conspiring to kidnap Americans in Yemen and planning to establish a jihad training camp in rural Oregon, began in New York with opening statements on Thursday.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/17/justice/new-york-terror-trial/index.html

snippet.title: A new player steps into South Carolina governor's race
snippet.description:
* South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley is one of the GOP's brightest stars, a 42-year-old Indian-American, a dynamo fundraiser and a favorite of national Republicans eager to showcase diversity in their ranks.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/22/politics/ervin-south-carolina-governor/index.html

snippet.title: Texas family plagued with ailments gets $3M in 1st-of-its-kind fracking judgment
snippet.description:
* When the Parr family started having serious health problems late in 2008, they had no idea it was associated with what they call "a multitude" of drilling operations that popped up near their 40-acre ranch in Decatur, 60 miles northwest of Dallas.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/25/justice/texas-family-wins-fracking-lawsuit/index.html

snippet.title: Man serving life in 1957 cold case appeals his murder conviction
snippet.description:
* "Nostalgia" and flimsy evidence led to guilty verdicts in the nation's oldest cold case ever solved, according to the man serving a life sentence for kidnapping and murdering a neighbor's child in 1957.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/21/justice/oldest-cold-case-appeal/index.html

snippet.title: Has Bangladesh learned lessons from Rana Plaza tragedy?
snippet.description:
* By Alyssa Ayres, Special to CNN Editor’s note: Alyssa Ayres is senior fellow for India, Pakistan, and South Asia at the Council on Foreign Relations. She served as deputy assistant secretary of state for South Asia during 2010-2013. You can follow her...
http://globalpublicsquare.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/24/has-bangladesh-learned-lessons-from-rana-plaza-tragedy/

snippet.title: Russia sanctions: EU should leave trade alone
snippet.description:
* With a breezy sweep of his pen President Vladimir Putin wrote a new chapter into Crimea's turbulent history, committing the region to a future returned to Russian domain.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/20/business/europe-russia-sanctions-dos-santos/index.html

snippet.title: Journalists charged over human trafficking report are released on bail
snippet.description:
* Two journalists in Thailand have been released on bail in a controversial defamation case that has raised concerns over press freedom in the country.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/18/world/asia/thailand-phuketwan-bail/index.html

snippet.title: 11 assassination spots you can visit
snippet.description:
* Death -- one of life's great unknowns, yet it comes to all of us.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/24/travel/assassination-spots/index.html
